page.title: 03The Leftwich Coal Merchant
page.content: Mr. Broady,the coal merchant is the middle man between the coal producer and the customer.He serves homes and some local industries.He delivers coal in bags on a lorry.The Broadies have been coal merchants for three generations.Mr. Broady started work when he was 14 years old,and his Father when he was 11 years old.The price of coal today is relatively more expensive than in the past.In 1903,for instance,coal was 2s 6d a bag; and in 1985 it is Â£4.45 a bag. Many people still use coal.Nowadays they have started building houses again with chimneys,unlike 20 years ago.
